text: The "William Tell Overture" is a piece of music by Gioachino Rossini. He wrote it for his opera, William Tell. The opera was first performed in 1829. The overture has four sections: * Dawn; * Storm; * Call to the Cows; often used in animated cartoons to signify daybreak * March of the Swiss Soldiers; famous for being the theme music for the The Lone Ranger. Category:Compositions by Gioachino Rossini Category:Overtures
title: William Tell Overture
